You know things will go bad when a government station has sole right to show a great sporting event, while the votes from last month's election are still being counted. Lo and behold! Yesterday was the proclamation day, and some people didn't want that. So they ranted on and on about cheating and stuff. I missed the Germany-Czech Republic match! And for what? These people don't know the first thing about shock. Ever since the election - May 10, Philippine Standard Time - the opposition's been ranting about massive cheating and various versions of "I wuz robbed!" speeches. C'mon! If you have evidence, show it all at once to the proper people, and stop repeating it every damned day. If you do, the people'll tire of your rants and dismiss you for someone who can't stand defeat. No, I'm not pro-GMA - Gloria Macapagal-Arroyo, the diminutive Philippine prez. I hate her. But if you plan on proving her sleaziness, you do it with finesse. The people here have a saying: Nobody loses; either you win or you're cheated. That's how tired we are of hearing claim after claim of vote manipulation. You do it with sufficient evidence - that's important - and in proper time - which is equally important. Let's leave this all behind. France will win Euro 2004. Any other result would be a scam! And the pot calls kettle black.
